intro: Planchonella skottsbergii, commonly known as the kauri apple, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and elongated, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible, fleshy berries that are used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, lowland areas and is often found in coastal forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts in its native range.
